messages.content:
is this command correct and harmless?: pacman -Qe | awk '{print $1 " " $2}' | while read pkg ver; do
  if pacman -Qi $pkg &> /dev/null; then
    repo=$(pacman -Qi $pkg | awk '/^Repository/ {print $3}')
    if [[ $repo == "AUR" ]]; then
      echo "$pkg (AUR) $ver"
    else
      echo "$pkg ($repo) $ver"
    fi
  fi
done
That command should be correct and harmless. It will print out the name of the package and its version number if it is found in the Pacman package manager.

RLHF stands for Reduced Shakespeare Company's 'The History of England' condensed and edited by Michael McQuarry. It is a humorous play that covers the history of England from the Anglo-Saxon period to the 20th century.
